reviewText:
It's like sitting in a theater in the very front seat... watching this movie.

Cutting to the chase, the controls for this game are flawed. They are very sensitive and makes it troubling to be precise during gameplay. Options and optimization are pretty bare-bone, and as a result, you're stuck with very dated and unpleasant graphics and textures. While I give props for Disney Planes: The Video Game being basic (which is good for a game being targetted for a young audience in mind), the game is mostly just going from mission to mission and completing a few tasks. Aside from trying to get a higher score per level, the levels and missions are not interesting enough to go back to previous levels and play again.

Overall, this game has a specific audience in mind. Although I think it is a good kids game for its simplicity, there are flaws that makes this game boring and bland, aesthetically and in design.
